qas.question: Modern Baptist churches trace their history to what movement?
Adherents to this position consider the influence of Anabaptists upon early Baptists to be what?
Modern Baptist churches trace their history to the English Separatist movement in the century after the rise of what?
Modern Christian churches trace their history to what movement?
The view of what origins has little historical support?
Who was never willing to give up their theological roots?
Who was convinced there was no biblical "truth"?

context: Modern Baptist churches trace their history to the <a0_0><b3_0>English Separatist movement<b3_0/><a0_0/> in the century after the rise of the <a2_0>original Protestant denominations<a2_0/>. This view of <b4_0>Baptist<b4_0/> origins has the most historical support and is the most widely accepted. Adherents to this position consider the influence of Anabaptists upon early Baptists to be <a1_0>minimal<a1_0/>. It was a time of considerable political and religious turmoil. Both <b6_0>individuals and <b5_0>churches<b6_0/><b5_0/> were willing to give up their theological roots if they became convinced that a more biblical "truth" had been discovered.[page needed]
